alert.note: Alert for Clackamas; Tillamook; Washington; Yamhill (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 1:45PM PST until December 22 at 2:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following counties, Benton, Clackamas, Lincoln, Linn, Marion, Multnomah, Polk, Tillamook, Washington and Yamhill. * WHEN...Until 845 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM PST, Heavy rain has ended. But, small streams and creeks remain rather full of water, and will continue to see minor flooding. Also, overflowing water in poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen oer the past 3 day. Conditions will gradually improve this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive around barricades or across low crossings that are flooded.
